contents

Class TransitionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • contents.TransitionManager

  • public class TransitionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for handling transitions easily. All you must do is create a new TransitionManager object, then, before doing any actual actions with it, you must define the type of transition using the "SetTransition" method. After that, you must update and draw the TransitionManager.

      • SetTransition

        public void SetTransition(TransitionManager.Transition t,
                          double rateOfChange)
        Sets the type of transition to perform as well as the amount to transition by.
        Parameters:
        t - -- The type of transition to perform.
        rateOfChange - -- The amount by which to change the drawings on the screen.

      • getTransition

        public TransitionManager.Transition getTransition()
        Returns the current type of transition that this TransitionManager is set to perform.
        Returns:
        transition -- the transition that is currently set to be performed.

      • transitionSet

        public boolean transitionSet()
        Boolean for whether or not this TransitionManager's transition type has been set. Mostly for error checking purposes.
        Returns:
        returns whether or not the transition has already been set.
